required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Insulin-sensitive Obesity: Lessons From Longitudinal Data
clinical_study.official_title: Insulin-sensitive Obesity: Prospective and Interventional Studies

collaborator.agency: Baker IDI Heart and Diabetes Institute

brief_summary.textblock:
People who are overweight and/or obese usually are insulin resistant and so are at risk of type 2 diabetes. However, research has shown that some overweight and/or obese people remain insulin sensitive and healthy despite their weight.
The investigators hypothesise that insulin-sensitive overweight and/or obese people maintain their insulin sensitivity and metabolic health over time. The investigators also hypothesise that the preservation of insulin sensitivity will be determined by key metabolic factors.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change in insulin sensitivity at follow up compared to 6 years ago
primary_outcome.description: Insulin sensitivity will be assessed in this current follow up study. This will be compared to insulin sensitivity data collected in this study cohort approximately 6 years ago.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in anthropometry (weight, height, BMI, waist and hip circumference)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change at follow up compared to 6 years ago

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total body fat and distribution
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change at follow up compared to 6 years ago

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fasting insulin, c-peptide, glucose levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change at follow up compared to 6 years ago

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c, 75g oral glucose tolerance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change at follow up compared to 6 years ago

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fasting non-esterified fatty acids and lipids profile
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change at follow up compared to 6 years ago

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in circulating adipokines, cytokines and hepatokines
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change at follow up compared to 6 years ago
Change at follow up compared to 6 years ago

arm_group.description: Participant's metabolic parameters are followed up after approximately 6 years.

intervention.description: Metabolic health, anthropometry, body fat distribution, liver lipid will be followed up in individuals previously studied at the Clinical Research Facility.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participation in the previous SiDIRAD (1) or EXCESS (2-6) study.
- Willingness to give written informed consent and willingness to participate in and comply with the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant and/or lactating women.
